paper_metadata.title: MAIN TEXT
paper_metadata.extraction_summary: Extracted genetic variant information for the TTR gene, including penetrance data.

individual_records.evidence_sentence: Patients with ATTRm present at an earlier age (40 to 75 years) than those with ATTRwt.
Val-30-Met is the most common pathogenic mutation globally and is the leading cause of familial amyloid polyneuropathy.
Patients with ATTRm present at an earlier age (40 to 75 years) than those with ATTRwt.

functional_data.summary: The Val30Met mutation leads to misfolding of TTR protein, resulting in amyloid fibril formation.

variants.segregation_data: Yes, segregates with disease in families.
variants.additional_notes: The Val30Met mutation is the most studied variant in TTR-related amyloidosis.
key_quotes: Val-30-Met is the most common pathogenic mutation globally and is the leading cause of familial amyloid polyneuropathy.
Patients with ATTRm present at an earlier age (40 to 75 years) than those with ATTRwt.

extraction_metadata.notes: Data was extracted thoroughly from the main text.
